FuncDef: The display ip-pool pool-usage command displays the usage of the address pool of every domain.
CLIs: display ip-pool pool-usage { pool-name [ pool-name ] | all | vpn-instance [ vpn-instance ] }
display ip-pool pool-usage vpn-instance { all | vpn-instance verbose }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an address pool. If pool-name is not specified, the usage of all local IPv4 address pools will be displayed. If pool-name is specified, the usage of a specific IPv4 address pool will be displayed.
The value is a string of 1 to 128 case-insensitive characters.

Displays the usage of all IPv4 address pools, including the local and remote address pools. The number of addresses in the remote address pool is the number of IP addresses in the network segment of the gateway.
-

Specifies the name of a VPN instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-insensitive characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If no domain is specified, the usage of the address pool of every domain is displayed. If a domain is specified, only the usage of the address pool of the specified domain is displayed. If an address pool is bound to multiple domains, the address pool is counted once. If users go online from one domain bound to the address pool, the usage of the other domains bound to the address pool is also counted.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
